overallSummary: Fabio Giglietto has a substantial social media presence across Mastodon, LinkedIn, and Bluesky, totaling 3580 followers. His content focuses on research, tools, and opportunities in computational social science, disinformation studies, and social media analysis. Engagement varies across platforms, with LinkedIn garnering higher engagement per post compared to Mastodon and Bluesky.

contentThemes.description: Posts related to research findings, papers, and projects in computational social science.
Content focused on the study of disinformation, coordinated inauthentic behavior, and information operations.
Posts announcing job openings, research grants, and opportunities for PhD students.
Content regarding tools such as CooRnet, and discussions on methodological approaches for studying disinformation.

recommendations: Increase cross-platform promotion to leverage audience overlap.
Utilize platform-specific content formats to maximize engagement.
Encourage more interaction through questions, polls, or open-ended discussions.
Share visual content (images, videos) to improve engagement.
Maintain a consistent posting schedule on each platform.

platformInsights.bluesky: Bluesky demonstrates a solid follower base and consistent engagement across various posts, particularly those related to new publications and research opportunities. Reposts are a prominent engagement metric.
platformInsights.mastodon: Mastodon exhibits a more community-driven environment, with posts focusing on discussions and tool releases. Engagement is lower compared to other platforms.
platformInsights.linkedin: LinkedIn shows a professional audience interested in career opportunities and research funding. Posts announcing grants and job openings generate significant interest and engagement.
